guide.introduction: In this hack we will explore hosting a web font on a cloud drive. In order to do so, we will learn how to configure an Amazon S3 bucket to accept requests from other domains.
guide.introduction_rendered: In this hack we will explore hosting a web font on a cloud drive. In order to do so, we will learn how to configure an Amazon S3 bucket to accept requests from other domains.
guide.summary: Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) is a specification that allows applications to make requests to other domains from within the browser. With CORS you have a secure and easy-to-implement approach for circumventing the browser’s same origin policy.
guide.title: HTML5 Hacks - Configure Amazon S3 for Cross Origin Resourse Sharing to Host a Web Font
